title: Famous Logos
description: Can you identify these iconic brand logos from their descriptions?

questions.question: Which company's logo features a simple bitten apple silhouette?
questions.explanation: Apple's iconic logo is a simple apple silhouette with a bite taken out of it. The 'bite' was reportedly included so the apple wouldn't be confused with a cherry.

questions.question: Which fast-food chain is known for its golden arches logo?
questions.explanation: McDonald's golden arches, forming the letter 'M,' are one of the most recognized logos in the world. The arches were inspired by the original restaurant's architecture.

questions.question: Which athletic brand uses a simple curved checkmark (swoosh) as its logo?
questions.explanation: Nike's 'Swoosh' logo was designed by graphic design student Carolyn Davidson in 1971 for just $35. It represents the wing of the Greek goddess Nike.

questions.question: Which car manufacturer has a logo featuring four interlocking rings?
questions.explanation: Audi's logo of four interlocking rings represents the merger of four car companies — Audi, DKW, Horch, and Wanderer — into the Auto Union in 1932.

questions.question: Which company uses a logo of a mermaid (siren) in a green circle?
questions.explanation: Starbucks uses a twin-tailed mermaid (siren) as its logo. The image was inspired by a 16th-century Norse woodcut found by the company's co-founders.

questions.question: Which car brand has a logo featuring a prancing horse on a yellow background?
questions.explanation: Ferrari's prancing horse (Cavallino Rampante) was originally the emblem of Italian WWI pilot Francesco Baracca. Enzo Ferrari adopted it in 1929.

questions.question: Which technology company is known for its multicolored 'window' logo divided into four panes?
questions.explanation: Microsoft's logo features four colored squares (blue, orange, green, and yellow) arranged as a window, representing its flagship Windows operating system.

questions.question: Which luxury fashion brand uses interlocking 'C' letters as its logo?
questions.explanation: Chanel's interlocking CC logo was designed by Coco Chanel herself in 1925. The two C's face in opposite directions and overlap, representing her initials.

questions.question: Which delivery company uses an arrow hidden between the 'E' and 'x' in its logo?
questions.explanation: The FedEx logo contains a hidden arrow between the letters 'E' and 'x,' symbolizing speed and precision. It is considered one of the cleverest logos ever designed.

questions.question: Which car manufacturer's logo features a three-pointed star inside a circle?
questions.explanation: Mercedes-Benz's three-pointed star represents the company's ambition to dominate land, sea, and air transportation. It was first used in 1909.

questions.question: Which brand features a logo of three stripes, originally representing a mountain?
questions.explanation: Adidas's three-stripe logo was redesigned in 1991 to form a mountain shape, symbolizing the challenges athletes face. The original three stripes date back to 1949.

questions.question: Which company's logo features a smiling arrow going from A to Z?
questions.explanation: Amazon's logo features an orange arrow pointing from the letter 'A' to 'Z,' indicating they sell everything from A to Z. The arrow also forms a smile.

questions.question: Which Italian car brand uses a logo featuring a trident?
questions.explanation: Maserati's trident logo was inspired by the Fountain of Neptune in Bologna, Italy, where the company was founded in 1914.

questions.question: Which electronics company is known for its logo that resembles a musical note or quarter note?
questions.explanation: Beats by Dre has a lowercase 'b' enclosed in a circle that resembles a person wearing headphones or a musical note, reinforcing its audio brand identity.

questions.question: Which brand's logo features a crown and has been associated with watchmaking since 1905?
questions.explanation: Rolex's five-pointed crown logo has been a symbol of prestige in watchmaking since the company was founded by Hans Wilsdorf in 1905 in London.
